content: Is there a way to purge data from a zulip installation? I have a backup/restore that failed (corrupted backup) and I do not want to re-install the OS. I would like to purge the zulip installation of data but not have to re-install the OS or zulip.
you probably want deployments/current/scripts/setup/postgres-init-db which will drop and create dfault db
also ~/uploads will have the user avatars and file attachments
I feel like this question was asked in multiple places, but that's roughly correct. We could probably make a wrapper around those steps.
@Tim Abbott hello, could you help me?
@huangdc sure, ask your question on a new topic.
